intro: Microrrhinum cryptarum, commonly known as the cryptic microrrhinum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils. The plant features finely divided, aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in shaded, woodland areas and is known for its subtle appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
